attributes.action: Drink in customers use of takeaway cups to be banned due to high waste volume
attributes.background: I work for one of the large chain high street coffee shops and I find it  astounding how much waste is created in these establishments alone, the worst needless waste I have seen is customers requesting takeaway cups to sit in. This needs to stop or legislation brought in to discourage this.
attributes.additional_details:
Over 3 Billion disposable coffee cups are used every year in the UK with only 1% being recycled. It is becoming an issue which can not be ignored. I understand that asking people to not use takeaway cups and bring their own is unrealistic but stopping the use of takeaway cups for sit in customers would be a fantastic start towards ending the practice and the needless waste created.

https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2016/mar/16/takeaway-coffee-cups-recycle-environment-waste

attributes.action: Reduce income tax paid on bonus payments
attributes.background:
We work hard to achieve a bonus at work, however the tax that we are paying on bonuses is nearly a third including NI contributions.

Bonuses are achieved by companies and/or individuals doing well in their career and they deserve to earn their full reward for this.

attributes.action: Pubs closed from 27th to 30th Dec for service staff to have a Christmas break
attributes.background: Worked in hospitality all my life, never had time to be with family over Xmas, why should we not have a few days off.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to breed dogs without being a registered breeder
attributes.background: It should be illegal to breed dogs unless you are a breeder registered on some sort of national register in order to stop people breeding dogs for the wrong reasons and purely for financial gain. It would also help prevent the horrific treatment and breeding in these 'puppy farms'
attributes.additional_details: A national register of breeders should be produced with them all being regulated my a body of animal welfare officers. Anyone breeding outside of these registers should be prosecuted and liable to an unlimited fine.

attributes.action: Promote responsible drinking by enforced water stations in pubs, bars and clubs
attributes.background:
Significantly reduce incidents and Public Sectors costs, following other countries' lead by highlighting re-hydration in establishments with alcohol consumption. 
Eliminate queuing up and faux pas amongst peers by having water and electrolyte fluids available in prominent areas relative to capacity
attributes.additional_details:
Alcohol related incidents cost the public sector millions which can be significantly reduced by having easily identifiable water stations in all establishments. 

This can be done by having large containers or a simple bar tap facing the customer and also through encouragement of re-hydration electrolytes in between and after alcoholic drinks. 

NSW in Australia has a similar project already in place and the UK government should follow suit benefiting individuals and the greater community.

attributes.action: treat addiction as a mental health problem rather than criminal justice problem
attributes.background: The war on drugs has been a war fought with misinformation. We should not punish addicts but treat their addiction and what they choose to escape from when under the influence of substance abuse.
attributes.additional_details: Chasing the scream by Johann Hari

attributes.action: Stop government deducting pensions
attributes.background: Stop ex-serviceman having their army pension deducted from their current benefit
attributes.additional_details: Just been called in to the job centre as part of my partner's ESA claim to find out that my army pension will be deducted from her ESA claim at the rate of Â£25 per week why having served 16 years in the army I know there are people worse off than me but I think it's a crying shame that ex servicemen who have given up their time to serve their country be penalised in later in life please find this position and get the government to change this the pension was rightfully earned and now the government of rightly taking it away from us why

attributes.action: Make all tax on income, business rates and revenue fair and consistent
attributes.background: Companies making billions in revenue from operating in the UK can take advantage of tax loopholes, government deals and reduced tax rates, yet the burden of the tax bill is being paid by the average employee being taxed on a basic rate of 20% and national insurance at 13.8%. PAYE needs to be fairer.
attributes.additional_details:
The government will reduce the amount of corporation tax paid by businesses to 17% by 2020, yet if you are an employee on a standard PAYE system you're taxed at a basic rate of 20% which can increase up to 45%. How is this right?

You can not take advantage of these rates, tax is taken automatically from your salary every month. The government continues to give tax breaks to the people that own these companies, not the employees that are paying a disproportionate tax rate to their employers.

attributes.action: Enforce child protection regulations on all businesses and organisations.
attributes.background: In light of the recent exposure of sexual abuse of children in football there needs to be a way. Child protection appears as a haphazard control with many organisations failing to offer the most basic protection
attributes.additional_details:
There needs to be enforceable rules
All adults must have a DBS
All companies and organisations should be registered with an official body, e.g. Ofsted. All credentials must nbe verified especially when used in advertising and websites. Child referees must be registered with the local authority ( the FA refuse to accept responsibility for children who work as referees) The current position of stating if the parents allow it must be revoked as parents expect official bodies to make competent decisions on their behalf.

attributes.action: Enable Greater Flexible Working For Parents.
attributes.background: The cost of childcare is not the only barrier influencing parents returning to work (that's another story). Many parents find it incredibly difficult to get a job due to the rigidity of working hours. We shouldn't have to choose between going to work or being a parent. Let's change that!
attributes.additional_details:
Currently you can only apply for flexible working arrangements when you have been in employment for 26 weeks. Many job seeking parents cannot work prescribed hours and care for a family, and so they are excluded from the job market. 
Rigid working hours exclude many parents from contributing to society and contributing to their family income.
Enable employers to offer greater flexibility with working hours for parents from the start. Enable flexible start and finish times, not prescribed hours.

attributes.action: Make the carrying and use of self defence weapons legal for woman in the U.K.
attributes.background: In the UK it's illegal to own, carry or use self defence weapons such as CS gas or pepper spray.  Statistics for violent and sexual crimes are on the rise with more woman being attacked each day. A system needs to be put in place where woman can legally own, carry and use self defence weapons.
attributes.additional_details:
http://rapecrisis.org.uk/statistics.php
http://www.bsdgb.co.uk/index.php?Information:Law_Relating_to_Self_Defence

attributes.action: Allow some freedom of movement in any UK-EU trade deal
attributes.background: The UK voted to leave to control immigration but that makes a UK-EU trade deal unlikely. The UK government should allow some degree of freedom of movement so we have full single market access. This is means we are able to trade freely yet have some control on EEA immigration.
attributes.additional_details: We should allow free movement of citizens only on the basis that they have paid taxes and NI for 5 years before claiming welfare. They will only be allowed non urgent healthcare if they reside for at least 6 momths. We will allow EEA students to study under Erasmus but introduce a EEA school permit so they will need to pay an annual fee for state education. This reduces pull factor yet it doesn't violate free movement laws. We can compromise on EU structural funds.

attributes.action: Grant legal rights of bodily liberty/integrity to apes, dolphins & elephants.
attributes.background: International scientific studies on genetics, intelligence, emotions and the social lives of these animals have proven to shown these animals are self-aware, autonomous beings.

attributes.action: To stop the repeal of the Human Rights Act 1998
attributes.background: As part of my citizenship coursework, I am doing a campaign around stop the repeal of the Human Rights Act 1998 and having the law replaced with the British Bill of Rights.

attributes.action: Change the law so neighbours can't play loud music at anytime not just after 11
attributes.background: In todays world people don't just work 9 till 5 and require sleep at various hrs of the day. Police have no powers to intervene before 11pm or after 7am. People have been forced to move and made ill from being forced to put up with music played unacceptably loud within flats.

attributes.action: Employers to give mothers returning from maternity leave flexible working hours.
attributes.background: This is an issue that many mothers have wrongly encountered. We as mothers should be given the right to have flexible working hours that balance our home and work life. We should not be discriminated for having children.
attributes.additional_details: Applying for flexible working hours to be abolished. Mothers should be offered flexible hours in their current position or offered in same grade position elsewhere. If this is not feasible, lower grade flexible working position.

attributes.action: Save Scotland's Military bases
attributes.background: The Government has decided that 8 of Scotland's Military Bases will close within the the next 16 yrs. This is unacceptable! We in Scotland have some of the best fighting forces in the world, but due to a shortsighted Tory regime, they are going to remove most of our capabilities!

attributes.action: The prohibition of  vehicle drivers smoking whilst driving
attributes.background: Drivers concentration must be  affected by smoking whilst driving.Observation  over many years show drivers smoking are often  using one hand to control the vehicle- lighting up and extinguishing the cigarette  must further affects drivers concentration

attributes.action: Close Pentonville Prison
attributes.background: This prison is failing both inmates and the general public, and needs to be closed immediately.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/crime/two-prisoners-escape-pentonville-prison-north-london-ministry-justice-a7402701.html

attributes.action: Impose a life long ban for HGV drivers caught driving while using mobile device
attributes.background: I suggest that any HGV driver caught driving whilst using a mobile device, should be issued a instant life long ban. In view of the amount of accidents and deaths caused by this. If applicable an additional fine to the registered keeper of Â£5000.00 should be issued.
attributes.additional_details: I suggest that any HGV driver caught driving whilst using a mobile device, should be issued a instant life long ban. In view of the amount of accidents and deaths caused by this. If applicable an additional fine to the registered keeper of Â£5000.00 should be issued. UK courts should also have the power to ban foreign drivers to the UK upon presentation of their licences at UK ports.

attributes.action: Increase public awareness and penalties for using mobiles whilst driving.
attributes.background: A mother and three young children were needlessly killed by a lorry driver using his phone recently. A massive  government information campaign is needed to help stamp this thoughtless practice out, also use of existing cameras for prosecutions and an instant twelve month ban for offenders as in DD.

attributes.action: Offer support mentally for citizens dealing with life changing disabilities
attributes.background: For example, many people in the UK suffer with a life limiting/ changing disability. Help as such as how to operate a wheelchair, how to tune cochlear implants etc is provided by the nhs. No help mentally is provided to help people adjust to their new lives.
attributes.additional_details: I know many people including myself who have suffered from a life changing disability. Obviously these disabilites have a major effect on our life and how we see it. Out of everyone i know, not one fraction of us was offered someone to talk to.

attributes.action: Agency workers need to be protected against unfair dismissal by law.
attributes.background: After being let go from an agency working position, I realised that agency workers have little to no rights or protection when it comes to unfair dismissal or even being able to have times off for emergencies (unlike their contracted counterparts).

attributes.action: Stop premium rate mobile phone service subscriptions without confirmatory text
attributes.background: Many mobile phone users have found themselves subscribed to premium rate services which are charged to their phone bills simply because they closed an unwanted pop up advert while browsing the internet. There is no cooling off period, and usually no confirmation text so bill payer is not aware!
attributes.additional_details: To stop the charges being levied unfairly there should be a 14 day cooling off period before any service charges, secondly, as many of these services don't send a confirmation text that a subscription has been set up the mobile phone user may not know. The law must be changed to stop these unfair subscriptions and charges.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on Oxfordshire's membership of the European Union
attributes.background: In the 2016 EU Referendum Oxfordshire voted to stay in the EU 70% to 30% but now risk being dragged out of the EU like Scotland and having a vote on the membership is in no way subverting democracy
attributes.additional_details: Oxford is a city who's economy is reliant on the EU and dragging them out would be completely undemocratic

attributes.action: Make the DWP provide email contact details so deaf people can get in touch too.
attributes.background: Access to work are making it extremely difficult to get back into work and off benefits, leaving people without money during training. I want to make a complaint but on their website they only list telephone numbers. This is useless to a deaf person like myself.
attributes.additional_details:
In order to get access to work help for an interpreter during training, ESA must be cancelled. Training is 3 hours a week on minimum wage before the actual job starts, leaving people with no money. More discrimination here because if an interpreter was not required, a person can claim ESA during training as they are not working enough hours per week to come off it. 

I want to make an official complaint via email and receive a quick response but the DWP only provide telephone numbers.

attributes.action: Make education of communism and its policies mandatory in all education
attributes.background: People need to be aware of the potential of a better life

attributes.action: Hold a confirmatory referendum to give clarity to the EU referendum
attributes.background:
The UK has voted to leave the EU, but it does not know what it wants or how its elected government is to put its wishes into effect.
Proposed second referendum to ask:
Are you sure?
To which answer,
Yes, leave EU at any cost,
No, remain in EU and seek changes to EU constitution
attributes.additional_details:
The UK electorate has now had the opportunity to examine the consequences of the referendum but it has had no voice in saying how the country will pursue its future foreign policy and its trading relationships.
There is anecdotal evidence that the vote was used as a protest against the current political establishment.
A second referendum, if positive, will provide political legitimacy to the current government.

attributes.action: Make the UK a permanent armed neutral country like Switzerland.
attributes.background: Since Switzerland became an armed neutral power in 1815 the UK has approximately been involved in 50 conflicts and lost 1,540,462 UK military and civilian life's (20 of those conflicts and 7456 lifes have been lost since WW2).
attributes.additional_details: Becoming an armed nurtality country, would still enable us to keep our armed forces and deter or counter any invasion force to the UK or any overseas British territory.

attributes.action: Require proposed Great Reform Bill to give Parliament a veto on terms of BREXIT.
attributes.background: A repeal bill has been proposed to enable BREXIT, as of the date BREXIT takes effect. We propose this bill contain provisions for a Parliamentary vote or referendum approving the terms of BREXIT, and that for the purposes of the Act BREXIT shall not take effect until such approval has been given.
attributes.additional_details: We the people have the undisputed right, per the 2016 referendum to leave the EU. If the terms of leaving are unacceptable, it should neither be disputed that we have the right to change our minds. While it appears the Prime Minister intents to trigger article 50 without Parliamentary consent or knowledge of a likely deal, Parliament and the people can be given a say by the mechanism described above. The Act means the proposed Great Repeal Bill referred to by Mrs May in Conference on 02/10/2016.

attributes.action: Make it possible  to  pay a modest amount as extra tax  to fund the NHS
attributes.background: So many of us deplore the state of the health service, and the conditions in which  committed professional staff are expected to fulfil the role. Allowing individuals to commit a dedicated amount each month specifically to be spent on the NHS  could correct this .

attributes.action: Introduce a bill to set a higher minimum wage for zero hours contracts
attributes.background:
We call on the government to introduce a bill to set a higher minimum wage for hours worked above contract hours. This would set a higher minimum pay rate for zero hour/minimal hours contracts.

Hours worked above contracted hours the minimum pay rate must be at least 1.25 times the minimum wage.
attributes.additional_details:
The aim of this bill is to target employers who systemically provide employees with contracts for considerably fewer hours than they would normally be expected to work. The most extreme case of this is employers who widely use zero hours contracts.

In the example of a zero hours contract the minimum pay rate would be Â£9 per hour based on the current National Living Wage of Â£7.20. The same minimum rate would apply to other overtime.

attributes.action: Reduce VAT on Food & Drink in cafe's etc. to 10% & lower the threshold to Â£40K
attributes.background: Across Europe there are 14 member countries that charge VAT at 10% or less on food and drink served in pubs, cafes, restaurants etc. Some small businesses falsely declare lower turnovers to ensure they do not come into the VAT scope. CafÃ© A pays 20% VAT being honest, CafÃ© B pays 0 and avoid VAT.
attributes.additional_details: If the VAT is reduced to 10% this would have a positive effect on the economy and tourism. By lowering the threshold on the same you bring more businesses into scope which would benefit the treasury for the lost VAT income and reduce fraudulent under declaring of turnover closing a tax avoidance loophole. It would also mean that there was a level playing field for businesses to compete and encourage growth. The general public would receive better value and comparison if all on the same tax

attributes.action: Offer more medical school places
attributes.background: The GMC limit the number of places avaliable for students studying medicine at university. By keeping the number of places the same, doctors numbers within the NHS won't rise putting patient care at risk. By offering more places longer term the NHS can employ more doctors and improve patient care

attributes.action: Scottish Referendum question must include guarantees on borders and currency
attributes.background: In order to avoid confusion and uncertainty any future Scottish Referendum question must gurantee that there will be no hard border between Scotland and England and must also name a valid currency which any future independent Scottish Government would have legal permission to use.

attributes.action: Permanently move both Houses of Parliament out of the 'Westminster Village'.
attributes.background: In view of modern communications technology, there is no reason for   Parliament and the bulk of the civil service to be concentrated in a small area which is both immensely expensive and isolated from the bulk of the electorate. Let both houses move to more suitable accommodation in other cities.
attributes.additional_details: Valuation Office Agency figures suggest that the average rateable value of office space in Manchester and Birmingham is 128 per metre^2, compared to 462 in Westminster. Many departments are already responding to this challenge by relocating offices out of London. Parliament should follow suit, acquiring better equipped modern premises in provincial cities, which, beside the savings to the taxpayer, would help to remove MPs and Peers from the isolated "village" in which they work at present.

attributes.action: Make all dental treatment free for the over 60's
attributes.background: Dental treatment is too expensive for the over 60's and those on pensions, most other things for the over 60's are either free or reduced, (Prescriptions, Opticians) but not the dentist this needs to change. Liquidising food to feed someone isn't the way forward in the 21st centaury.

attributes.action: Parliament to review Credit agency unfair rules.
attributes.background:
Credit agencies have set rules which can be unfair and damaging to many a young person, punishments can often be more harsh than court rulings,  also trying to sort out a problem is very difficult due to conflict ions between credit companies, and information providers,  
i give one example below.
attributes.additional_details:
Eg,
in 2012 i was ill and fell behind 3 month mortgage payments,on a second property, i sold the house paying off my missed payments in the sale, yet i was put on a delinquent list, this is now on for 6 years, this is ridiculous. the same would apply to a your post grad who made teenage mistakes, and now may have to wait 6 important years of his life to fix.
there are no ways to resolve these problems early, even criminals in jail can get time off for good behaviour, please review the rules.

attributes.action: End the inequality and offer fathers the same paternity leave as mothers.
attributes.background:
Women in the UK are entitled to paid maternity leave up to 39 weeks. 

Men only get 2 weeks.
attributes.additional_details:
To deny fathers the same benefit is unfair, unequal and sexist, the father should be available to help the mother of a new born child, a very difficult time for many families. For up to 39 weeks with pay as women are. 
Many women who have C sections or difficult births require extra care, especially if they already have an older child. 
2 weeks leave is not suitable or long enough to allow a father to bond with a new baby and to aid the recovery of his partner after child birth/C section.

attributes.action: Provide funding for external wall insulation for homes
attributes.background: Similar to recent schemes for funding of cavity wall insulation, we'd like funding for external wall insulation for homes that aren't suitable for cavity wall insulation, such as solid wall, Stone and concrete homes.
attributes.additional_details:
Live in a concrete house myself which is unsuitable for cavity wall funding. During winter we find it too unbearable with no heating on, for example waking up with frozen finger tips, toes and noses. Due to central heating costing too much as heat is lost through the walls and takes too long to heat the house up, we can't afford to have the heating on very long.

External wall insulation is too expensive for home owners to fund themselves, having been quoted around Â£15k for a 3 bed semi myself

attributes.action: Stop ministers from overuling local councils in rejected planning applications.
attributes.background: A controversial plan for 450 homes on Medwayâs green lung will go ahead, after the minister has rubber stamped and ignored local residents and local councillers. This development goes against the very clear wishes of the public.
attributes.additional_details:
Durring the mornings and evenings rush hours the roads around this proposed development are jammed with too many vehicles as it.
 This area of Lordswood simply cannot cope with anymore houses. The local doctors surgerys cannot and will not see the existing patients in a timely manor, The local accident and emergency is the Medway Maritine hospital which is in continual special measures and cant cope. Drainage and water supplies are also strained

attributes.action: Members of the House of Lords are taxed on their daily allowance of Â£300.
attributes.background: All members of the House of Lords are entitled to claim a daily untaxed allowance of Â£300 even if they only sign in and immediately leave the chamber.  This is disgraceful.They should be taxed.

attributes.action: To close a gap in the law, disability discrimination - a school place rejected.
attributes.background: The law prevents to make an appeal on disability discrimination case against LA if they fail to secure a place at chosen by parents school. School also cannot be a challenge on this issue. In the result no one is responsible and a disabled child is discriminated when that placement is rejected.
attributes.additional_details: Under Schedule 17 of the Equality Act, 2010 Tribunal Special Educational Needs and Disability only has the power to consider a claim against the responsible body for school and cannot consider a claim against the local authority for the exercise of powers to determine the admission. The decision about child admission is made by local authority only and if the process is not correct parents cannot pursuit claim of disability discrimination against the local authority.

attributes.action: Abolish the drivers insurance instead have a insurance based on the car they own
attributes.background: Most of the countries around the world including Europe calculate insurance based on the car you own. Why in England we need to pay insurance based on the driver? Once car is insured any driver with the legal driving license can drive that car! Isn't is so easy? Please support this petition. Thanks

attributes.action: To hold a referendum on whether or not to we continue to pay Foreign Aid
attributes.background: The government debated, loosely, the merits of foreign aid payments as a fixed percentage of GDP back in mid 2016.  This decision needs to be taken out of the hands of government and put into the hands of the people via a referendum.  Circa Â£12bn per year is at stake to public services.
attributes.additional_details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/125692

attributes.action: Remove the statue of Oliver Cromwell outside Parliament.
attributes.background:
Although he made change for the good, he still became a ruthless dictator. Why should the following be welcomed by parliament:
Killing over 250,000 people whilst conquering Ireland, which Cromwell justified as the "righteous judgment of God upon these barbarous wretches".
attributes.additional_details: He enforced his rule using the military, with the governors who ruled England under him ex-military generals who were extremely brutal. Although Christianity or being a Puritan isn't a defined good or bad trait, he forced all to follow his religion, forcing fasts, banning any form of work on Sunday and banning any fun, like Christmas or work.

attributes.action: Simplify marriage law and remove references to sex or gender
attributes.background:
Marriage in the UK is governed by multiple acts of parliament with specific laws for civil partnership and same sex marriage.  However, the legislation still sees same sex and opposite sex couples differently.

The law should be consolidated and simplified to correct this.
attributes.additional_details:
The law on marriage should be rewritten with all references to sex, gender and/or sexual orientation removed.  Terms for unions should be standardised and include a distinction between religious and civil unions.

When changing legal gender a person should not be required to dissolve or convert an existing union.

Religious organisations should be still allowed to refuse to perform weddings which would contradict their faith but this right should not be limited to same sex marriages.

attributes.action: Make Bullying in the workplace a criminal offence.
attributes.background: Bullying is wrong. Bullying goes on in the workplace.  It can be being left out , whatever it may be.  It can be being ignored.  It can be not getting that promotion.  Social media passive aggressive post. Commenting on work performance negatively, and talking in derogatory terms.
attributes.additional_details: Workplace Bullying is rife. A real problem, that can have severe consequences to a person being bullied. Just because a manager may smile at you, does not mean that they aren't bullying someone else.

attributes.action: Ask Mr Trump to conduct his visit virtually and use money saved to support NHS
attributes.background: Her Majesty's Government, in the interest of economy, respectfully request that president Donald Trump, given his preference and aptitude for social media, conduct his visit virtually by electronic means and that the monies saved should be used immediately to support the National Health Service.

attributes.action: Make first aid training courses free
attributes.background: There is no price on life. Children should be taught first aid in school. Adults should be taught first aid at work. We should be able to act automatically when someone is in need of life-saving aid.
